snippet: The experimental musician Theo Bleckmann has released an album of Kate Bush’s songs, one of a series of projects that could raise awareness of this German-born singer.
lead_paragraph: On a Thursday evening in January the David Rubenstein Atrium at Lincoln Center was packed -- many were turned away at the door -- for a rare performance of Kate Bush's music. It was a big deal for fans of that reclusive British art-rock singer. Despite releasing records more or less steadily over the years, Ms. Bush has never performed a concert in the United States. And she hasn't toured anywhere, singing in public only rarely since a one-month string of European shows in 1979.

headline.main: A Singer of Art-Rock and Bach (He's a Yodeler, Too)
